questions.question_text: An engineer is deploying a VXLAN EVPN environment for a customer. The customer’s environment suffers from a large amount of flooding related to hosts attempting to resolve the MAC to IP mapping on the network segment. Which feature prevents this issue from happening in the future?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A correct

Selected Answer: A
A correct

Selected Answer: B
Anycast gateway is a feature commonly used in VXLAN EVPN deployments to optimize the handling of ARP
https://www.ciscopress.com/articles/article.asp?p=2803865&seqNum=2

questions.question_text:
Due to a major version change, an engineer must perform a software upgrade on a Cisco Nexus Series switch.

Which two technologies should be implemented to reduce disruptions to the network during the upgrade? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
A. vPC
B. HSRP
It´s correct

choices.B: Enable the Infra VLAN on the Interface Profile policy.
choices.C: Enable the Infra VLAN on the Attachable Access Entity Profile.
choices.D: Add the infra VLAN via the physical domain.
choices.A: Add the infra VLAN via the VMM domain.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/dcn/whitepapers/cisco-application-centric-infrastructure-design-guide.html

Selected Answer: C
Create an attachable entity profile and assign the above PhysDom to it. Also make sure Enable Infra VLAN is selected:

On the menu bar, choose Fabric > Access Policies > Global Policies and right-click Attachable Access Entity Profile to create an attachable access entity profile.

In the Name field, enter the name of the attachable access entity profile. (For example, OSP13-AEP.)

(Optional) In the Description field, enter the description of the attachable access entity profile.

Check the Enable Infrastructure VLAN check box to enable the infrastructure VLAN.

In the Domains (VMM, Physical or External) To Be Associated To Interfaces: section, click on the + icon, from the drop-down list, choose the domain profile and click Update.

Click Next.

Click Finish.

Selected Answer: C
https://techgenix.com/cisco-aci-attachable-access-entity-profiles/
C is correct
It´s correct

questions.question_text: An engineer must allow communication between the APIC controller and an OpenStack OpFlex agent. The agent is running on a compute node directly plugged to a Cisco ACI leaf switch. The engineer must enable and extend Infra VLAN on the port facing the compute and extend the Infra VLAN to the host. Which action must be taken to meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
Answer is correct

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus9000/sw/7-x/system_management/configuration/guide/b_Cisco_Nexus_9000_Series_NX-OS_System_Management_Configuration_Guide_7x/b_Cisco_Nexus_9000_Series_NX-OS_System_Management_Configuration_Guide_7x_chapter_011100.html#task_52D8A0952B06404197D2536B6E33EE80
It´s correct

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

An engineer configures the NetFlow feature on a Cisco NX-OS device. The requirement is to reduce the amount of export data collected by using a sampler. Drag and drop the NetFlow configuration steps from the left onto the implementation needed to meet these requirements on the right. Not all steps are used.

//IMG//

choices.D: Perform a system configuration backup and run the merge import method.
choices.C: Perform a logical configuration backup and run the replace import method.
choices.B: Perform a full state configuration backup and run the restore procedure.
choices.A: Perform an all configuration backup and run the system restore procedure.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct : configurations of the chassis, FEX, rack servers, IOMs, and blade server.

Selected Answer: D
System Configuration—The backup file preserves identities for Chassis, FEX, Rack Servers, and user labels for Chassis, FEX, Rack Servers, IOMs and Blade Servers.

Selected Answer: D
It cannot be C. As per the document below, a logical configuration backup doesn't store chassis, FEX, IOMs, blade/rack servers information.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/ucs-manager/GUI-User-Guides/Admin-Management/4-2/b_Cisco_UCS_Admin_Mgmt_Guide_4-2/m_backup_and_restore_configuration.html

comments.content: you are right, system configuration with preserved identities checked. System Configuration—The backup file preserves identities for Chassis, FEX, Rack Servers, and user labels for Chassis, FEX, Rack Servers, IOMs and Blade Servers.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct with "Preserved Identities" checkbox checked

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

I'd say B, full configuration: ''You can use the file generated from this backup to restore the system during disaster recovery. ''.
Other files cannot be used for system restore. 
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/ucs-manager/GUI-User-Guides/Admin-Management/4-1/b_Cisco_UCS_Admin_Mgmt_Guide_4-1/m_backup_and_restore_configuration.html#task_D97990B1ED0F4BCB8469D5A671774B5D
But the issue is that in the question it is mentioned that the XML encoding shold be used, and the full sate is binary.... 

Even here the Full state is mentioned :
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/ucs-central/install-upgrade/2-0/b_Cisco_UCSC_Install_and_Upgrade_Guide_2_0.pdf

comments.content: Full-state format is not XML. IT is binary.

Import Methods
You can use one of the following methods to import and update a system configuration through Cisco UCS Manager:


Merge—The information in the imported configuration file is compared with the existing configuration information. If there are conflicts, the import operation overwrites the information on the Cisco UCS instance with the information in the import configuration file.

Replace—The current configuration information is replaced with the information in the imported configuration file one object at a time.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Could be either C or D but I think I will vote for C

Configuration Logical—Backs up up all configuration information but not AAA (Authentication, Authorization, and Accounting) related information.
Configuration System—All AAA-related information.

Selected Answer: D
System Configuration—The backup file preserves identities for Chassis, FEX, Rack Servers, and user labels for Chassis, FEX, Rack Servers, IOMs and Blade Servers.

Selected Answer: C
Only logical configuration will backup configurations

Logical configuration—An XML file that includes all logical configuration settings such as service profiles, VLANs, VSANs, pools, and policies. You can use the file generated from this backup to import these configuration settings to the original fabric interconnect or to a different fabric interconnect. You cannot use this file for a system restore.

If you choose system configuration it will backup user accounts, labels etc.

Beside only option C have "replace" as a method which we need to use for this task.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct. ( a - all cannot be "restored", b - full is binary, c - incomplete content)
The Answer is ''D"

Selected Answer: D
System Configuration—The backup file preserves identities for Chassis, FEX, Rack Servers, and user labels for Chassis, FEX, Rack Servers, IOMs and Blade Servers.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/ucs-manager/GUI-User-Guides/Admin-Management/4-1/b_Cisco_UCS_Admin_Mgmt_Guide_4-1/m_backup_and_restore_configuration.html#task_D97990B1ED0F4BCB8469D5A671774B5D

Selected Answer: C
To accomplish the task of backing up and restoring the Cisco UCS Manager configuration with XML encoding on a remote server, the engineer should perform a logical configuration backup and run the replace import method. This will include the configurations of the chassis, FEX, rack servers, IOMs, and blade server and store them on the remote server in XML encoding

comments.content: Full state is binary file. So I think it should be D.

niulf, yes, It is binary, but only full state is used for restore. Other types cannot be used for restore. So either the questions is incorrect, and instead the XML should be bin in the question , or there is no correct answer

discussion.content: It´s B

questions.question_text: An engineer must perform backup and restore of the Cisco UCS Manager configuration. The configuration must be stored on a remote server via XML encoding. The backup must store the configurations of the chassis, FEX, rack servers, IOMs, and blade server. Which set of actions accomplishes these goals?
